thread.title: Market falls as miners and banks retreat
thread.title_full: Market falls as miners and banks retreat

title: Market falls as miners and banks retreat
text:
Wed, Jul 22, 2015, 12:45 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 3 hrs 15 mins Market falls as miners and banks retreat AAP – 11 minutes ago Print 
The share market is one per cent lower amid bad news from BHP and falls by other market heavyweights. 
The big banks, retailers and Telstra were all lower, while BHP was down 1.3 per cent at $26.465 after flagging a $US650 million hit to full year profit due to weakness in its copper business. 
Rio Tinto was also weaker, down 1.2 per cent at $52.76. 
Gold miners were among the best performers, rebounding after the price of the precious metal stabilised overnight. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1230 AEST, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 56.3 points, or 0.99 per cent, at 5,650.4 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was down 52.8 points, or 0.93 per cent, at 5,635.4 points. 
* The September share price index futures contract was 52 points lower at 5,594 points, with 11,572 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 828 million securities worth $1.99 billion. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Inflation provides few worries for RBA AAP 
The Reserve Bank may worry about sharply rising house prices in parts of the country, but overall price inflation …
